Description: Blue(originally) glazed composition shabti of Horwedja with a striated lappet-wig, a modelled face with a beard and crossed hands holding a relief adze, a hoe and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the leg section is inscribed with nine rows of Hieroglyphic text; back-pillar and a plinth.
Curator's comments: Many other shabtis of the same man are known. For another example and a list of other specimens in other collections, see Glenn Janes, Shabtis: A Private View. Ancient Egyptian Funerary Statuettes in European Private Collections, Paris 2002, pp. 194-7.
